Attribute Penalty.name: Attribute Penalty
Attribute Penalty.description: One attribute (but not its linked skills) suffers a -1 penalty. For 3 points, it suffers a -2 penalty. If Strength, this applies to damage as well.

Big.name: Big
Big.description: The race is particularly large in a world where most others aren't. He subtracts 2 from Trait rolls when using equipment that wasn't specifically designed for his race and cannot wear their armor or clothing. Equipment, food, and clothing cost double the listed price.

Cannot Speak.name: Cannot Speak
Cannot Speak.description: The race has no vocal cords or cannot form the sounds made by most other races. He can communicate with members of his own race naturally (through song, pheromones, body language, etc.). Other races can't speak his “language” but may learn to understand him if they take the proper Language skill. The species can hear and understand other typical languages and may communicate via electronic devices or the like.

Dependency.name: Dependency
Dependency.description: The race must consume or have contact with some sort of relatively common substance for an hour out of every 24. Creatures from water-based worlds, for example, might need to immerse themselves in water; plant people might need sunlight. Without the required contact, a character becomes Fatigued each day until Incapacitated. A day after that, they perish. Each hour spent recovering with the appropriate substance restores a level of Fatigue.

Environmental Weakness.name: Environmental Weakness
Environmental Weakness.description: The race suffers a -4 penalty to resist a particular environmental effect, such as heat, cold, etc. If the being suffers an attack based on that form, the penalty acts as a bonus to damage.

Frail.name: Frail
Frail.description: The creature is less durable than most. Reduce its Toughness by 1.

Hindrance.name: Hindrance
Hindrance.description: The race has an inherent Minor Hindrance for 1 point, or a Major Hindrance for 2. This doesn't affect the ability to choose other Hindrances during character creation.

Poor Parry.name: Poor Parry
Poor Parry.description: These beings are poor melee defenders; -1 Parry.

Racial Enemy.name: Racial Enemy
Racial Enemy.description: This species dislikes another species relatively common to the setting. They suffer a -2 penalty to Persuasion rolls when dealing with their rivals and may become hostile with little provocation. This may only be taken once per race.

Reduced Core Skills.name: Reduced Core Skills
Reduced Core Skills.description: This race starts with one less core skill. The skill may be gained normally but does not start at a d4. This may be taken once per core skill affected.

Reduced Pace.name: Reduced Pace
Reduced Pace.description: For -1 point, reduce Pace by 1 and the running die a die type (d4 is reduced to d4-1). For -2 points, reduce Pace another 2 points and subtract 2 from Athletics and rolls to resist Athletics where movement and mobility are integral to the challenge (GM's call).

Size.name: Size
Size.description: The entity is smaller than average, reducing its Size and Toughness by 1 (see the Size Table, page 179).

Skill Penalty.name: Skill Penalty
Skill Penalty.description: The race suffers a -1 penalty to a very commonly used skill such as Fighting, Persuasion, or even Piloting in a game focused on airplanes (the GM decides based on her campaign). If the skill is less common or only comes up in certain situations, the penalty is −2. For 2 points, the penalty is −2/−4 instead.
